channel.title: Is it normal
channel.description:
.. that I can do certain things like 200% better when I'm extremely tired? My writing is always the most vivid and descriptive when I'm barely able to keep my eyes open. My reaction time is amazingly fast, and I can destroy on drums better than I ever could when I wasn't sleepy. Same goes for video games, I can dominate matches on call of duty when I'm really tired...
Just wondering if anyone else ever experiences this or if there's a psychological explanation?
Edit: My appreciation for music is also so much stronger, it's like I rip apart every tiny meaning that every lyric has, and I just understand it so much better than I normally do

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @Get_Forgotten Get_Forgotten
item.description:
@Get_Forgotten wrote:

With me my alertness increases by alot, but my reaction time seems to take the dive, ias in playing video games such as CoD I can see everyone who kills me, But I fail to react in time to win.

But my concentration goes up as well, it is also like this when I’m high, but when I’m drunk everything nosedives and I can’t do shit

Read full topic

gay

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:15, topic:363986”]I’m better at succeeding to get sex when i’m tired. When you act dis-interested in sex, woman tend to want to extract it from you then if you’re all over them. It’s a catch 22 though, because I really won’t want it if i’m tired, yet it’s extremely hard to act like I don’t when I’m awake.[/quote]My bf doesn’t like it when I’m sleepy, and pokes me until I’m alert

Read full topic

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

.5 kdr? l2play kid

joking,

OT: I usually play better after half an hour of game play for about 45-90 mins

Read full topic

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

My KDR on a FPS is normally ~.5, but when I was playing dead tired last night it was over 2.0…

I think it might be because when you are tired, you are focusing on less things than when you are awake. So if you’re playing a game, your entire consciousness is with the game, not being distracted by other things. Same with being drunk, you tend to only be paying attention to a few things at once.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

I’m better at succeeding to get sex when i’m tired. When you act dis-interested in sex, woman tend to want to extract it from you then if you’re all over them. It’s a catch 22 though, because I really won’t want it if i’m tired, yet it’s extremely hard to act like I don’t when I’m awake.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

It reminds me of being high/drunk.

When your high/drunk certain senses go up.

Such as high:

• Hearing x2
• Hunger x2
• Video Gaming - 1
• Vision - 1

Drunk:

• Reflexes - 10
• Gaming - 10 (reflexes are bad therefore gaming is too)
• Hunger + 2

Its all about what your brain is focusing on more. When your tired/drunk/high your brain will focus/not focus on certain things.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

My ability to do certain things is heightened, but my tolerance for things not going perfect is terrible. Example. Building something and say… Using a saw and breaking the blade. Usually you would just change it out and continue working, but when i’m tired I just say fuck it.

Read full topic

Yea i get better at games but more frustrated with gfx

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

To be fair i can do some stuff better too. im hyper pretty much all the time but when im tired i seem to pay more attention to what im doing.

item.title: Is it normal
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Perhaps your ‘instinct’ (for lack of a better term) takes over? IE your auto pilot.

That’s how it feels like. Maybe it’s that your brain is too tired to conceive everything around you and so limits it’s focus to what you chose and hence the ‘heightened concentration’ where you have more control over what you want to think about.

Read full topic

I get about 200% better at sleeping when I am extremely tired.

item.description:

I think this is related to the ballmer peak:

ballmer_peak.png652×592

Which, from personal experiance, is true exactly how that cartoon explains it, up to a point you get better, then drastically worse.
